title: How to Customize the Size of the Windows 7 Taskbar Icons

steps.title: Open Start .
steps.content: Open Start . Click the Windows logo on a blue background in the bottom-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Click Control Panel.
steps.content: Click Control Panel . This tab is on the right side of the Start menu. If you don't see Control Panel here, type "control panel" into Start and then click Control Panel when it appears at the top of the Start window.

steps.title: Click Task Bar and Start Menu.
steps.content: Click Task Bar and Start Menu . It's toward the bottom of the Control Panel page. Doing so will open the Taskbar window. If you don't see this option, click the "View by" drop-down box in the top-right side of the window, then click Large Icons .

steps.title: Click the Taskbar tab.
steps.content: Click the Taskbar tab. This option is in the top-left side of the window.

steps.title: Select a taskbar button type.
steps.content: Select a taskbar button type. Click the "Taskbar buttons" drop-down box, then click one of the following options: Always combine, hide labels - Condenses taskbar buttons into squares that display the program's icon, but not its label. Multiple windows from one program will fit into one taskbar button. Combine when taskbar is full - Displays rectangular taskbar buttons individually and with labels until the taskbar fills up, at which point buttons are combined into the square configuration mentioned above. Never combine - Taskbar buttons will remain rectangular with labels regardless of how many there are.

steps.title: Check the "Use small icons" box.
steps.content: Check the "Use small icons" box. This box is near the top of the page. Doing so will shrink your Windows 7 icons on the taskbar. If this box is already checked, your computer is displaying small icons in the taskbar.

steps.title: Click Apply, then click OK.
steps.content: Click Apply , then click OK . This will save your changes and refresh the screen. Once the screen refreshes, your taskbar icons should be smaller (or larger) than they were before.

steps.title: Open Start .
steps.content: Open Start . Click the Windows logo on a blue background in the bottom-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Click Control Panel.
steps.content: Click Control Panel . This tab is on the right side of the Start menu. If you don't see Control Panel here, type "control panel" into Start and then click Control Panel when it appears at the top of the Start window.

steps.title: Click Display.
steps.content: Click Display . It's toward the top of the Control Panel page. Doing so will open the Display window. If you don't see this option, click the "View by" drop-down box in the top-right side of the window, then click Large Icons .

steps.title: Click Adjust resolution.
steps.content: Click Adjust resolution . This link is in the upper-right side of the page.

steps.title: Click the "Resolution" drop-down box.
steps.content: Click the "Resolution" drop-down box. It's in the middle of the page. Doing so will prompt a drop-down menu with all of your monitor's possible resolutions listed.

steps.title: Increase or decrease your screen's resolution.
steps.content: Increase or decrease your screen's resolution. Click and drag the slider up to increase resolution and make icons smaller, or drag the slider down to decrease resolution and make the icons larger.

steps.title: Click Apply.
steps.content: Click Apply .

steps.title: Click Keep changes when prompted.
steps.content: Click Keep changes when prompted.

steps.title: Click Make text and other items larger or smaller.
steps.content: Click Make text and other items larger or smaller . This link is in the middle of the page. Doing so takes you to the Appearance and Personalization menu.

steps.title: Select a size option.
steps.content: Select a size option. Click the circular button to the left of one of the following options: Smaller - 100% Medium - 125% Larger - 150% - Not all monitors will have this option.

steps.title: Click Apply.
steps.content: Click Apply . It's in the lower-right side of the page.

steps.title: Click Log off now when prompted.
steps.content: Click Log off now when prompted. Doing so will log you out of your account. Once you log back in, all of your icons will be larger or smaller depending on the options you chose.

steps.title: Open Start .
steps.content: Open Start . Click the Windows logo in the bottom-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Type run into Start.
steps.content: Type run into Start. Doing so searches your computer for the Run program.

steps.title: Click Run.
steps.content: Click Run . This program, which resembles a speeding envelope, should be at the top of the Start window.

steps.title: Type regedit into Run, then click OK.
steps.content: Type regedit into Run, then click OK . Doing so will open the Registry Editor program. You may have to click Yes when prompted before you can continue.

steps.title: Open the WindowMetrics folder.
steps.content: Open the WindowMetrics folder. To do so: Double-click HKEY_CURRENT_USER . It's in the top-left side of the Registry Editor window. Double-click Control Panel . Double-click Desktop . Click WindowMetrics .

steps.title: Double-click MinWidth.
steps.content: Double-click MinWidth . This item should be on the right side of the Registry Editor window. Double-clicking it opens it in a new window. If you don't see the MinWidth item, first do the following: click Edit , select New , click String Value , type in MinWidth , and press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Enter in the new width.
steps.content: Enter in the new width. Type in a new width for icons, then press ↵ Enter . The default width for regular icons is 52, and the minimum you can enter is 32—anything smaller, and the icons will not display properly. You can enter values larger than 52, though icons too large will cause problems on the taskbar.

steps.title: Restart your computer.
steps.content: Restart your computer. Open Start , click ► , and click Restart to restart your computer.

steps.title: Re-pin your icons.
steps.content: Re-pin your icons. Windows caches icon images when applications are pinned, so you will need to re-pin any pinned icons for the new size to take effect. Right-click on each pinned icon and select "Unpin". You can then re-pin the program by right-clicking on it in the Start Menu and selecting Pin to Taskbar . [1] X Research source
